Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 1383.
_description: The sleepless lover — three eight-line stanzas, aaabcccb, or quatrains with internal rhyme, plus burden: ‘Saunce remedy [ ]payne dedly for my maystres…’

BodAsh176.First Lines:
Sauns remedye endure must I in paynes deadly for my mistresonlesse
                    that she doe me petye of her bountye & great goodnes…
BodAsh176.Last Lines:
…Or elles trulye endure must I in paynes deadly for my
                    mistresalas that she doth not petye of her bountye & great
                    goodnes
BodAsh176.Editions:
Wagner,  B. M. 
             “New Songs of the Reign of Henry VIII.” 
             Modern Language Notes
         50 (1935): 452-55: 454.
